meanings.definition: Not staying in one place or position; moving or changing
meanings.sent1: The nonstationary clouds drifted across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The weather in our area is quite nonstationary.
meanings.sent3: The nonstationary chair kept rolling away from the table.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as nonstationary as a leaf in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The nonstationary river flowed swiftly through the valley.

meanings.definition: Not fixed or stable; variable or fluctuating
meanings.sent1: The nonstationary prices of the stock market make it unpredictable.
meanings.sent2: Her mood was nonstationary, changing from happy to sad in an instant.
meanings.sent3: The nonstationary Wi-Fi signal made it impossible to watch the movie.
meanings.sent4: The nonstationary economy was like a rollercoaster ride for investors.
meanings.sent5: The nonstationary population of the city made urban planning a challenge.
